Art. 4.87. 
Non-reportable gifts 
Gifts and legacies made to the spouse or legal cohabitant of an heir are not reportable.
If the gifts and legacies are made jointly to two spouses or legal cohabitants, only one of whom is entitled to inherit, he shall report half. If the gifts and legacies are made to the spouse or legal cohabitant entitled to inherit, he/she reports them in full.
Expenses for food, maintenance, education, apprenticeship, wedding expenses and customary gifts are not gifts. The nature of a customary gift is assessed at the date on which it is granted and taking into account the assets of the disposing party.
On the other hand, the report is due for what has been used for the establishment of one of the co-heirs, or for the payment of his debts.
